News.headline: Match Report: Dagenham & Redbridge 1-1 Macclesfield Town
News.page_title: Match Report: Dagenham & Redbridge 1-1 Macclesfield Town
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Dagenham & Redbridge 1-1 Macclesfield Town
News.short_description: The Daggers paid the price for some poor finishing when the visitors grabbed a last minute equaliser.
News.description:
Corey Whiteley, Frankie Raymond and Jordan Maguire Drew all had glorious  second half chances to put the game to bed, but tossed them away with poor finishing.

But although manager John Still has every right to complain about those misses he can't complain too much about the result

Macclesfield - up among the front runners with the Daggers - gave every bit as good as they got and were well worth their point.

They were a threat throughout and provided a good test for Still's team, who now know they can mix it with the  best of them.

They suffered a blow when Fejiri Okenabirhie, scorer of the goal that gave the Daggers the lead, was flattened by  Paul Lewis with less than 30 minutes gone and took no further part in the game..

Before he was put out of action Okenabirhie made the breakthrough in the 18th minute, firing home into the bottom corner after Whiteley created the opening with a good run down the right wing.

Whiteley skimmed the bar with a well struck effort on the stroke of half time and an effort from Maguire Drew was hacked off the line.

But the Daggers certainly did not have things all their own way. Kingsley James was just too high with a volley and Chris Holroyd went near with a first timer from a corner.

The goal for Macclesfield came after some sloppy play that left Holroyd free to bundle the ball just over the line with minutes to go. 

On chances created the Daggers could, and should, have won. But the result was about right and both these teams look equipped to sustain their challenge.

They will be hoping the damage sustained by Okenabirhie is not serious. And they also lost defender Craig Robson before the end.
